modules.description: Initializes an encoder with a dynamic table of specified memory capacity and encodes HTTP/2 headers into a Faraday buffer. Adjusts the dynamic table size at runtime based on provided byte limits. Used to prepare header data for transmission in HTTP/2 protocols.

Initializes a decoder with a dynamic table of specified capacity and allows adjusting that capacity dynamically. Parses HTTP/2 header blocks into a list of headers using an Angstrom parser. Designed for efficient header decoding in network protocols requiring dynamic table management.

Provides HTTP/2 protocol parsing and serialization using Angstrom and Faraday, supporting frame decoding, stream management, and header compression. Works with byte sequences, streams, and HTTP/2 frame structures to enable low-level protocol interaction. Used to build compliant HTTP/2 servers and clients, handle multiplexed requests, and manage connection-level settings.

Encodes and decodes HTTP/2 headers using dynamic tables that can be resized during operation. Supports encoding to a Faraday buffer and decoding from a byte stream into a list of headers. Provides control over memory usage through adjustable table capacities. Enables efficient header processing for both transmission and reception in HTTP/2 implementations.
